items.title: Demon Slayer: Infinity Train – Story and Characters of the Popular Movie!
items.content_html:
The Japanese anime series ‘Kimetsu no Yaiba’, also known as Demon Slayer in the West, has gained incredible worldwide popularity. This is definitely the kind of series that can appeal fans of any age, whether they be adults or children. Fans of the series are already familiar with the great success of the movie ‘Demon Slayer: Infinity Train’, which featured Kyojuro Rengoku, the Demon Slayer Corps Flame Hashira in addition to the main cast! In addition to this, the first part of the second season of the Demon Slayer anime, which recently started in Japan, will be a retelling of the same ‘Mugen Train Arc’ as the movie, with new animations! Fans of this series definitely have a lot to look forward to!

About Demon Slayer’s World of Men and Monsters


The Demon Slayer series begins in in the Taisho era of Japan (1912 – 1926). In the beginning, the protagonist Tanjiro and his family lived a simple life in the wilderness. One day Tanjirou went out to work, and when he returned home, he found that his mother and siblings had been massacred. Tanjiro immediately understood that his family had been attacked by demons, with his sister Nezuko as the only survivor. In order to save Nezuko, Tanjirou hurriedly carried her down the mountain to find help, but when she began to wake up, Tanjiro realized that Nezuko too had become a demon, and their adventures start from there.

The ‘Demon Slayer Corps’ of this universe is, just as its name implies, an organization dedicated to destroying all demons. Those warriors of the Demon Slayer Corps who are able to rise to the highest rank of Hashira are very powerful, but few in number. The Infinity Train of the movie and new season arc is a train that had been the site of many mysterious fatal incidents in the past. The Demon Slayer Corps sent many teams out to eliminate the cause of these incidents, but with no success. It was then decided to send Flame Hashira Kyojuro Rengoku to ensure that the task was completed. Protagonist Tanjiro and his friends from the Demon Slayer Corps are also sent to work together with the Flame Hashira, but no one expected the events that were to come…

Major Characters of the ‘Mugen Train Arc’

Tanjiro Kamado


The eldest son of the Kamado family, and the older brother of Nezuko. He lived a simple life with his family in the mountains. Tanjiro has dark reddish-black hair and red eyes, and his typical gear consists of his haori jacket, which features a square Japanese ‘Ichimatsu’ pattern, and his black sword. In order to find a way to turn his sister back into a human, Tanjiro was introduced into the Demon Slayer Corps by Giyu Tomioka, a the organization’s Water Hashira.

Find Tanjiro Kamado Goods On Buyee

Nezuko Kamado

Tanjiro’s little sister, and the only other survivor of the Kamado family after it was attacked by demons. After becoming a demon herself, Nezuko managed to suppress the demonic urge to attack humans, due to which the members of the Demon Slayer Corps decided to spare her.

Find Nezuko Kamado Goods on Buyee

Zenitsu Agatsuma

A yellow-haired swordsman who joined the Demon Slayer Corps at the same time as the main protagonist Tanjiro, Zenitsu has a very timid personality, but can show amazing strength when he faints/goes to sleep, although it seems that he has no memory of these periods.

Find Zenitsu Agatsuma Goods on Buyee

Inosuke Hashibira

Inosuke is a member of the Demon Slayer Corps like Tanjiro, who wears a wild boar head mask, deer hair around his waist, bear hair around his feet, and is a burly-looking figure who speaks loudly, but hides a beautiful face under his mask.

Find Inosuke Hashibira Goods on Buyee

Kyojuro Rengoku

The Flame Kashira of the Demon Slayer Corps, Kyojuro is a user of the Flame Breathing style. He has a boisterous personality, is capable of excellent leadership and judgment, and acts like a big brother for the other members of the team. In the Demon Slayer: Infinity Train movie, the scene where he endlessly shouts “Delicious!” has become a trending topic among fans.

Find Kyojuro Rengoku Goods on Buyee

Whether you have seen the original Demon Slayer anime series or the Infinity Train movie, now that the Mugen Train Arc is grabbing attention once again, it is a great opportunity to catch up on all of the demon slaying that you have missed! We recommend that you don’t pass this series up if you think that it could be fun for you!

items.title: What is the Japanese Series ‘Cells at Work’ All About?
items.content_html:
A different kind of anthropomorphic anime! People who like Japanese animation are certainly familiar with the term anthropomorphism. In the world of animation, many different types of ‘anthropomorphism’ have been depicted, including text, everyday objects, weather, emotions, etc. Continuing on from this tradition, in the 2015 “Monthly Shonen Sirius”, a new popular ‘anthropomorphic work’ appeared – the manga series ‘Cells at Work!’

The Vibrant, Hidden Setting of Cells at Work!

The original manga series of Cells at Work! began in 2015, and a related anime produced by the animation company David Production started its broadcast from 2018. The main draw of this series is the anthropomorphism of the cells that we all have within our bodies. With interesting and humorous scenarios, we can learn more about the daily operation of our bodies, the importance of the various cells in our bodies from the perspective of the stories and experiences of the red blood cell protagonist. This fun series exhibits an impressive amount of knowledge about how the cells in the human body operate!

What Makes Cells at Work! So Fun To Read?


The story of Cells at Work! begins with the daily routine of the protagonist AE3803, who is a female red blood cell. Like other cells, she does not have a personal name in the same way that a human would. However, AE3803 does have other nicknames, such as ‘Senpai’ or ‘Big Sister Red Blood Cell’. Different red blood cells have different personalities, and AE3803’s personality is particularly reckless, with her often getting lost in the blood vessels. Although she often delivers the wrong goods, and encounters germs and other crises, every time AE3803 seems to be rescued by the same white blood cell, who is responsible for removing the germs. But don’t mistake this part of Cells at Work! for a love story! Because white blood cells can travel to various parts of the body very quickly, this is another big reason why they are able to save AE3803 every time they come to clear the germs!


In the story, in addition to the main red blood cell and white blood cell characters that were just mentioned, there are also many other cells with strong personalities that are responsible for different tasks in the body, such as the child-like Platelet like children, the muscle-bound Killer T Cell, the motherly Macrophage and more! These unique personalities will all appear over the course of the protagonist red blood cell’s everyday routine. Simply by reading the deeply thought out story of Cells at Work!, readers can easily gain a deeper understanding of their own bodies, while watching fun interpretations of the interesting daily life of their cells!

Five Major Cells at Work! Characters

Red Blood Cell / AE3803

The heroine cell of this story, Red Blood Cell is a girl with short red hair who sports the ID number of AE3803. She has a gentle and cheerful personality, but at the same time can be a bit absent-minded. Her main job is to manage the daily transportation of nutrients, oxygen or carbon dioxide. Her uniform coat and hat can be worn on both sides, with the bright red side facing outwards when she is transporting oxygen and nutrients, and the dark red side when she is transporting carbon dioxide. She has a bad habit of constantly getting lost.

Browse Red Blood Cell Goods on Buyee

White Blood Cell / U-1146


Assigned with the ID number U-1146, this white blood cell often appears to save Red Blood Cell. His uniform, skin and hair are all white. With striking eyes, the dreadful aura he gives off when clearing the area of germs is so terrible that even the protagonist AE3803 wants to escape many times. Although he does not have his own name, like other white blood cells, he is generally called ‘Mr. White Blood Cell’. He usually seems to have an indifferent expression, but he is in fact very gentle and relaxed, always trying to take care of others.

Browse White Blood Cell Goods on Buyee

Killer T Cell

This muscular man possesses the most powerful combat ability in the immune system setting of Cells at Work! He is mainly responsible for dealing with special types of tough bacteria and virus-infected cells. Although He works in a similar manner to white blood cells, he is more fierce than the typical image people have of white blood cells.

Browse Killer T Cell Goods on Buyee

Macrophage

Macrophage is part of a special order of white blood cells whose main tasks include the destruction of foreign substances and the clearing of dying cells. She looks like a white Gothic maid, normally dressed as a noble and courteous woman. Some of her main characteristics are her polite, smiling demeanor, which hide the strange powers and killing techniques that are inconsistent with her appearance.

Browse Macrophage Goods on Buyee

Platelet

The childlike Platelet’s job is to close the wound when the body is injured from the outside or inside when an injury occurs, and to quickly stop bleeding. This platelet team leader with long blond hair has a close relationship with the main protagonists Red Blood Cell and White Blood Cell.

Browse Platelet Goods on Buyee

Cells at Work! is suitable for viewers of any age, with its fans ranging from children to adults. In recent years, the story of Cells at Work! has become even more relevant as recent pandemics have given people much more interest in learning more about their own bodies. If you want to take a look for yourself, it’s a learning experience that you won’t soon forget!

items.title: An Introduction to The World of Detective Conan!
items.content_html:
Detective Conan/Case Closed is a well-known and long running Japanese detective manga created by Gosho Aoyama. It depicts the adventures and cases of the protagonist, high school detective Shinichi Kudo, who is transformed into a child during the course of his investigations into a secret organization. The original manga series has been serialized since 1994, and has since been adapted into various spinoff works, including anime series, movies, OVA, special comics, and live-action TV series. The anime has been well received since it began broadcast in 1996. The various cases in the series have entertained countless everday fans and critics for years. This work is considered one of the most popular Japanese manga series. In addition to the many commemorations of the author Gosho Aoyama and his work in his hometown of Hokuei, including a museum, there are also statues of the Detective Conan protagonists and supporting characters in many public places across Japan.

Detective Conan’s History From 1994 to Today

Since the original Detective Conan manga began serialization, it has branched out into many different spin-offs across many kinds of media from 1994 to the present day. New series attached to the Detective Conan franchise are being produced at a regular pace even in 2021! Let’s look back on the history of this famous series, from its first publication to now!

The Main Characters from the Cases

Conan Edogawa / Shinichi Kudo

Conan Edogawa is the main protagonist of the Detective Conan series, and his real name is Shinichi Kudo. Although he looks 7 years old, his real age is 17 years old. Because of his first-rate reasoning ability, he is called “The Savior of the Japanese Police” and the “Holmes of Heisei (referring to the Japanese era name)”. He is a well-known high school detective in the Kanto region of Japan.

Find Conan Edogawa / Shinichi Kudo Products on Buyee

Ran Mori

The main heroine of the series, Ran Mori is a 17-year-old high school student. She is very skilled at karate, and is a captain of her karate team. A childhood friend of Shinichi Kudo, she secretly loves Shinichi, but does not know that Conan and Shinichi are the same person. She is the daughter of detective Kogoro Mori and lawyer Eri Kisaki.

Find Ran Mori Products on Buyee

Kaito Kid


Kaito Kid, whose real name is Kaito Kuroba, is a high school student and gentleman thief. He became the second generation Kaito Kid when he decided to pursue those responsible for his father’s death. This mysterious thief is known by many other nicknames as well. He is good at using magic techniques and disguising his identity. His main tool is a white Hang Glider Cape. An elegant gentleman who sometimes reveals a more mischievous side.

Find Kaito Kid Products on Buyee

Shuichi Akai

A 32 year-old top American FBI investigator and the eldest brother of the Akai family, Shuichi is very skilled at Jeet Kune Do. His sniper ability is also first-rate, able to hit targets from incredibly far distances with either hand or eye. He has a personal vendetta against the evil Black Organization for killing his love interest in the past.

Find Shuichi Akai Products on Buyee

Rei Furuya / Toru Amuro


Rei Furuya, also know by his pseudonym Toru Amuro, is a 29 year-old public security police officer under the Security Planning Division of the Police Security Bureau, a branch of the National Police Agency. He is a spy sent to investigate the Black Organization with the codename Bourbon. Rei has a contentious relationship with Shuichi Akai related to the death of Rei’s partner within the Black Organization, Scotch.

Find Rei Furuya / Toru Amuro Products on Buyee

The characters introduced above are highly popular with fans of the series, but there are many more to get to know in the story! In the end, the only way we think you can see the quality that has kept Detective Conan going for so long is to read it for yourself, so give it a try when you can!

items.title: Puella Magi Madoka Magica’s Story and Characters
items.content_html:
Have you heard of the Japanese ‘magical girl’ genre from anime and manga? Typically, magical girl series star heroines who are still young girls, but through the power of magic, she can power up to fight her enemies. These girls go through many struggles with the hope of eventually ushering in a happier future. However, the anime series ‘Puella Magi Madoka Magica’ which began in January 2011, turned this traditional magical girl story format on its head with its unforgettable setting and characters!

In the world of Madoka Magica, magical girls fight against beings known as ‘witches’. Kyubey, an alien creature, uses the promise of granting any single wish to entice young girls to become magical girls, with the hope that they can defeat witches. They became magical girls, who fight just like traditional magical girls side by side with their companions and defeated many powerful witches. However, there are dark secrets to this power that are revealed during this thrilling series!

The Release History of Madoka Magica

In addition to the memorable main story of Puella Magi Madoka Magica, there have been many side stories shown through comics and additional anime series helping hardcore fans gain a deeper understanding of the greater world of the series. If you are interested in Madoka Magica, we recommend that you finish watching the main anime series first, and then refer to the following info to continue with the most important main spinoffs!

The Magical Girls and Creatures of This Unique World

Madoka Kaname


The main heroine of the story, Madoka was originally an ordinary girl, but was stubbornly pestered by Kyubey to become a magical girl because of her good aptitude. At first, Madoka had an idolized perception of what a magical girl was, but after experiencing various tragedies and learning the truth about the soul gem, she had a different understanding of the magical girl’s contract, and she became timid and hesitant about whether to turn into a magical girl after all.

Find Madoka Kaname Goods on Buyee

Homura Akemi

A magical girl who transferred to Madoka’s class in Episode 1. She repeated puzzling instructions and warnings against Madoka becoming a magical girl. The narrative gradually reveals her secrets and tragic past. Her true identity is that of Madoka’s friend from a different timeline. In order to save Madoka, who has repeatedly died to the strongest witch Walpurgis Night, she has traveled through time many times to try to change the result.

Find Homura Akemi Goods on Buyee

Mami Tomoe


A third grade student of Mitakihara middle school, Madoka’s senior, and a strong magical girl. Fighting based on the belief of protecting others, Mami has a great positive influence on Madoka. In episode 3 of the anime, she dies tragically in front of Madoka and her companions while fighting the witch Charlotte.

Find Mami Tomoe Goods on Buyee

Sayaka Miki

Madoka’s classmate and friend, who becomes a magical girl. After accepting the contract, Sayaka felt that she was no longer a human being. She later accumulates a lot of negative emotions from a love triangle that she gets caught up in, which causes her Soul Gem to quickly turn into a Grief Seed, turning her into a witch.

Find Sayaka Miki Goods on Buyee

Kyubey


A cat-like animal that claims to be a magical messenger. In reality, it is a member of an alien race.. By fulfilling any wish of girls at the price of extracting their souls to make gems, Kyubey’s task is to urge the girls to sign a contract to become a magical girl. After its true purpose of using the girls as a consumable resource for squeezing out energy in order to extend the life of the universe is revealed, Kyubey argued that it is a reasonable judgment to sacrifice magical girls for the survival of the universe.

Find Kyubey Goods on Buyee

Kyoko Sakura

After Mami’s death, Kyoko set off to meet the magical girls in Mitakihara. Sayaka, who became a magical girl by making a wish for others in a similar way to Kyoko, is someone who she both clashes with but finds common ground with at the same time. The two are similar in nature, so Kyoko tries to gradually guide Sayaka and give her useful advice.

Find Kyoko Sakura Goods on Buyee

The animation of the Magic Girl Madoka Magica may seem very kid-friendly at first, but is probably more suitable for adults to watch. If parents plan to let their children watch this series, we would say to please do so with some caution!
items.content_text:
Have you heard of the Japanese ‘magical girl’ genre from anime and manga? Typically, magical girl series star heroines who are still young girls, but through the power of magic, she can power up to fight her enemies. These girls go through many struggles with the hope of eventually ushering in a happier future. However, the anime series ‘Puella Magi Madoka Magica’ which began in January 2011, turned this traditional magical girl story format on its head with its unforgettable setting and characters!



In the world of Madoka Magica, magical girls fight against beings known as ‘witches’. Kyubey, an alien creature, uses the promise of granting any single wish to entice young girls to become magical girls, with the hope that they can defeat witches. They became magical girls, who fight just like traditional magical girls side by side with their companions and defeated many powerful witches. However, there are dark secrets to this power that are revealed during this thrilling series!







The Release History of Madoka Magica



In addition to the memorable main story of Puella Magi Madoka Magica, there have been many side stories shown through comics and additional anime series helping hardcore fans gain a deeper understanding of the greater world of the series. If you are interested in Madoka Magica, we recommend that you finish watching the main anime series first, and then refer to the following info to continue with the most important main spinoffs!



Main Anime Series・12 EpisodesMovie Series (Beginnings, Eternal, Rebellion)・The third film, Rebellion, is a brand-new story after the main seriesNew Movie (Walpurgisnacht: Rising)・This upcoming film continues the new story of RebellionManga (The Different Story)・An alternate timeline story focusing on the character MamiManga (Puella Magi Oriko Magica)・A spinoff story by Kuroe Mura, following new character Oriko MikuniManga (The Innocent Malice)・A new story focusing on amnesiac magical girl Kazumi and her battles together with her friendsManga (The Legend of Jeanne d’Arc)・A spinoff story about the French heroine Joan of Arc







The Magical Girls and Creatures of This Unique World



Madoka Kaname







The main heroine of the story, Madoka was originally an ordinary girl, but was stubbornly pestered by Kyubey to become a magical girl because of her good aptitude. At first, Madoka had an idolized perception of what a magical girl was, but after experiencing various tragedies and learning the truth about the soul gem, she had a different understanding of the magical girl’s contract, and she became timid and hesitant about whether to turn into a magical girl after all.




Find Madoka Kaname Goods on Buyee








Homura Akemi







A magical girl who transferred to Madoka’s class in Episode 1. She repeated puzzling instructions and warnings against Madoka becoming a magical girl. The narrative gradually reveals her secrets and tragic past. Her true identity is that of Madoka’s friend from a different timeline. In order to save Madoka, who has repeatedly died to the strongest witch Walpurgis Night, she has traveled through time many times to try to change the result.




Find Homura Akemi Goods on Buyee








Mami Tomoe







A third grade student of Mitakihara middle school, Madoka’s senior, and a strong magical girl. Fighting based on the belief of protecting others, Mami has a great positive influence on Madoka. In episode 3 of the anime, she dies tragically in front of Madoka and her companions while fighting the witch Charlotte.




Find Mami Tomoe Goods on Buyee








Sayaka Miki







Madoka’s classmate and friend, who becomes a magical girl. After accepting the contract, Sayaka felt that she was no longer a human being. She later accumulates a lot of negative emotions from a love triangle that she gets caught up in, which causes her Soul Gem to quickly turn into a Grief Seed, turning her into a witch.




Find Sayaka Miki Goods on Buyee








Kyubey







A cat-like animal that claims to be a magical messenger. In reality, it is a member of an alien race.. By fulfilling any wish of girls at the price of extracting their souls to make gems, Kyubey’s task is to urge the girls to sign a contract to become a magical girl. After its true purpose of using the girls as a consumable resource for squeezing out energy in order to extend the life of the universe is revealed, Kyubey argued that it is a reasonable judgment to sacrifice magical girls for the survival of the universe.




Find Kyubey Goods on Buyee








Kyoko Sakura







After Mami’s death, Kyoko set off to meet the magical girls in Mitakihara. Sayaka, who became a magical girl by making a wish for others in a similar way to Kyoko, is someone who she both clashes with but finds common ground with at the same time. The two are similar in nature, so Kyoko tries to gradually guide Sayaka and give her useful advice.




Find Kyoko Sakura Goods on Buyee








The animation of the Magic Girl Madoka Magica may seem very kid-friendly at first, but is probably more suitable for adults to watch. If parents plan to let their children watch this series, we would say to please do so with some caution!

items.title: The Story and Characters of My Hero Academia
items.content_html:
Do you like superheroes? Whether it is Spiderman or Captain America in the United States, Ultraman or Kamen Rider in Japan, etc., heroes like these are beloved by dedicated fans the world over. In addition to these popular superheroes, there is a group of heroes from Japan that we hope you can become more familiar with – the main characters of the Japanese manga series ‘My Hero Academia’!

The World of My Hero Academia

In the world of My Hero Academia, abbreviated as ‘Hiroaka’, from a certain day, a large number of new generations of children suddenly began to have special abilities called Quirks. Nearly everyone who is born from this day on has some form of Quirk ability, and everyone’s Quirks has different characteristics. Overwhelming superpowers that previously had only existed in the realm of fiction are brought in reality, throwing human society into chaos.

People with special abilities and evil thoughts begin to use their Quirks for evil. These people are commonly known as Villians. Opposing these villians, those who possess both special abilities and a sense of justice are seen just like superheroes in everyone’s impression. Whenever the villains are destroying communities and causing chaos, these heroes will run out to fight and save those ordinary bystanders with no special Quirks.

The Protagonist has no Quirks?!

The protagonist Izuku Midoriya was born in an era when basically everyone has a personality and the world is full of heroes. Like other children, he has loved heroes since childhood. He is an especially big fan of the hero All Might, and hope to be a hero when he grows up. The new generation with personality usually shows signs of personality when he was young, but the signs of Quirks still would not appear. Due to his dream of being a hero, Izuku felt great regret at his diagnosis. The dream can never be realized. But one day when his friend Bakugo is attacked by a villain, Izuku unconsciously ran to face the enemy to save his friend, regardless of having no special abilities. This act of selfless heroism by this ordinary boy led All Might to decide that Izuku has a heroic temperament.

Even a Strong Hero Needs Partners!

Although Izuku has no Quirks, there is still a chance to inherit All Might’s abilities and become a hero through tough training. In order to become a hero, he starts to attend the hero’s school U.A. High School. Under the guidance of many heroes and teachers, Izuku works hard with his classmates to carry out various assignments and tasks to achieve his dreams.

At the same time, there was a deep mysteries with the hero All Might’s ability known as One For All, and an enemy trying to seize that ability soon appears. Izuku, who is gradually inheriting this ability, has naturally become the enemy’s target. In order to protect the inherited abilities, All Might and others around him have gradually become isolated, with many secrets that cannot be disclosed. At times, Izuku may have to fight alone, but his partners (classmates and teachers) did not intend to let him get overwhelmed by enemies, and show up to support him when the time is right!

My Hero Academia’s Main Players – 8 Heroes and 2 Villains!

Izuku Midoriya

The hero of My Hero Academia is rare in that he has no Quirk special abilities. He is a super fan of the hero All Might, and hopes to become a hero when he grows up. But after a doctor’s diagnosis, he found that he had no special skills, and his dream of becoming a hero was broken. When his friend Bakugo was attacked by a villain, he unconsciously ran to face the enemy to save his friend, which made the hero All Might realize that Izuku has a heroic temperament, and begin to hope that he could inherit his Quirk ability, known as ‘One For All’, and become its 9th generation successor.

Find Izuku Midoriya Goods

Katsuki Bakugo

Bakugo has known the protagonist Midoriya from a young age, and he was not friendly to him in the beginning of the story. His hero name is Dynamight, and his Quirk is Explosion. With extremely high combat awareness and reaction speed, he has a considerable advantage in close combat. The dream is to become a hero surpassing All Might.

Find Katsuki Bakugo Goods

Ochaco Uraraka

A classmate of Izuku, Ochaco’s hero name is Uravity, and she possesses the Zero-Gravity Quirk. Has a cheerful and bright personality. Because her family construction company has not been doing well, her goal is to become a hero and make a lot of money, so that parents can live a relatively easy life.

Find Ochaco Uraraka Goods

Tenya Ida

Tenya is another classmate of Izuku, and the Class Representative of Class A. His hero name is Ingenium, and his Quirk is Engine. Born into the heroic Ida family. He is determined to become a hero due to his admiration for his former hero older brother Tensei.

Find Tenya Ida Goods

Shoto Todoroki

A classmate of the Izuku, his hero name is Shoto, and he has the Half-Cold Half-Hot Quirk. He seldom uses the fire personality on his left side, because he resents his upbringing at the hands of his father, the harsh fire hero Endeavor. He hopes to prove to his father that even without using his personality, he can surpass All Might and become the number one hero on his own.

Find Shoto Todoroki Goods

Tsuyu Asui

A classmate of the protagonist Midoriya Ikuhisa, her hero name is Froppy, and she has the Frog Quirk. She has high insight, and she can be calm and unshakable even in the most stressful of situations. She often puts her fingers on her chin, and she can easily enter hibernation in cold temperatures.

Find Tsuyu Asui Goods

Eijiro Kirishima

A classmate of Izuku, Eijiro’s hero name is Red Riot, and his Quirk is Hardening. He is straightforward and has a heroic temperament similar to that of Izuku, and is the only student who can maintain a good relationship with Bakugo. He likes open confrontations, and detests surprise attacks or sneak attacks.

Find Eijiro Kirishima Goods

Tomura Shigaraki

The leader of the League of Villains/Paranormal Liberation Front, Tomura has the Quirk Decay. He is a student of All Might and Izuku’s nemesis All For One, and is the grandson of Shimura Nana, the seventh-generation successor of One For All.

Find Tomura Shigaraki Goods

All For One

The dark nemesis of All Might. His real identity is the older brother of the first generation One For All user. His real name is unknown, but his original surname is Shigaraki. Because of his blindness, he usually relies on an Infrared Quirk to explore the outside world.

Find All For One Goods

All Might

Known as the “Symbol of Peace” and the No.1 most popular hero, All Might is the 8th generation One For All successor, and the teacher of the protagonist Izuku Midoriya. His mantra is “It’s okay! Why? Because I’m here!”. Originally a person with no Quirks, he inherited One For All from Nana Shimura.

Find All Might Goods

From the manga to the anime series, the legions of fans of My Hero Academia has grown very large. Now that the manga has just entered a new chapter, and the plot is at a climax, those of you who are interested should definitely give it a look!

items.title: All About Kamen Rider Revice, 2021’s New Tokusatsu Series!
items.content_html:
In September 2021, the latest series of the long-running Japanese Kamen Rider series, Kamen Rider Revice, will begin its run on Japanese TV! In this new series, the main protagonist Ikki Igarashi is an ordinary person who grew up in a normal family. He is attacked by the evil Deadmans group when his family attends a ceremony for his younger brother, who is joining the elite anti-Deadmans corporation ‘Fenix’. This put Ikki into a crisis in which he had to protect his family, forcing him to make a contract with the demon Vice. As a result, Ikki transformed into ‘Kamen Rider Revi’, and Vice transformed into ‘Kamen Rider Vice’.

What Makes Kamen Rider Revice so Unique?

In the past Kamen Rider series, the protagonist generally transformed into a single Kamen Rider alter-ego, but when the protagonist in this installment transforms, the demon Vice in his body transforms as well, resulting in the transformed duo of ‘Kamen Rider Revi’ and ‘Kamen Rider Vice’. This allows two Kamen Riders to come from one transformation! By using Vistamps, Revi and Vice can also transform the weapons that they need, which is a little different from previous Kamen Riders’ fighting methods!

Rejoice! Kamen Rider Revice Toys are Already on Sale!

Although Kamen Rider Revice has just premiered in Japan, there are already many official pieces of merchandise available! There are various types of belts, stamps and models, etc. If you are interested, please give the following descriptions a look!

Transformation Belt Revice Driver


Set the Rex Vistamp on the belt and defeat the by stamp to activate the stamp stand rotation gimmick! The stamp pad rotates and faces forward, the LED emits light and the transformation sound is then activated! Enjoy acting out the transformations of Kamen Rider Revi and Kamen Rider Vice, and other special moves for the Rex Genome with the Rex Vistamp!

See More on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Revice Driver 50th Anniversary Special Set


A special set made for the 50th anniversary of the Kamen Rider series, it comes with a transformation belt, two Vistamps (Rex Vistamp + Batta Vistamp) and ‘HENSHIN BELT HISTORY’. HENSHIN BELT HISTORY is a commemorative book for the 50th anniversary of Kamen Rider. It has 22 full color pages (B5 size), which describes the history of Kamen Rider’s transformation belts.

See More on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

DX Eagle Vistamp and Vistamp Holder

This Eagle Vistamp can interact with the transformation belt of Kamen Rider REVI. The Eagle Vistamp debuts in Episode 2. For how to use this Vistamp with a transformation belt, please refer to the description of the first product in this section!

See More on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Ohinbuster50

Possesses a gun form and an axe form, which are the preferred weapons of Kamen Rider Revi and Kamen Rider Vice, respectively. The Ohinbuster50 first appears in the first episode of Kamen Rider Revice. Put a Vistamp onto the Ohinjector to perform its special move! Try to perform the different special moves for each animal Vistamp!

See More on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

‘A Kamen Rider protagonist who grew up in an ordinary family’, ‘A character who failed to transform (Ikki’s brother)’, etc. On the first day of airing, Kamen Rider Revice has already created many new fun topics of discussion for longtime Kamen Rider fans in Japan. There seems to be a lot of mysteries regarding the story and setting. We are really looking forward to the future developments in this exciting new series, and we hope that you are too!

Find Kamen Rider Revice Goods on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

items.title: The Characters and Story of JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure STONE OCEAN!
items.content_html:
When it comes to what draws fans to the beloved Japanese manga series ‘JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure’, what is usually cited as a factor is the very unique and expressive art style, as well the unforgettable story content. With these points in mind, it’s no wonder that JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure has become a very popular work all over the world! In our blog today, we will briefly get to know the plot and main characters of this unique world.

British Nobles and Cunning Vampires


The story of JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure is divided into eight separate series, covering both the British noble Joestar family, and the evil vampire Dio Brando and his successors in different themes and settings over the course of more than a century. Strengthen the showdown. Each installment has a different protagonist, and their nickname is JoJo. Although the settings are foreign, the fifth protagonist has Japanese heritage. In this world, a large number of supernatural elements such as vampires, zombies and ancient monsters have also been added, combined with real-world characters and events, giving JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure a richer world.

Releases on Netflix in December 2021!


At an animation event in August 2021, it was officially announced that an anime adaptation of the sixth story arc of JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure, Stone Ocean, will be released on Netflix, giving the world the opportunity to experience its fascinating story! This new anime series is being produced by studio David Production, director Kenichi Suzuki, supervisor Toshiyuki Kato, writer Yasuko Kobayashi, and composer Yugo Kanno. It will also be broadcast on major TV channels in Japan starting in January 2022.

The Main Characters of Stone Ocean

Jolyne Cujoh

Jolyne Cujoh, the protagonist of Stone Ocean is also known as JoJo, and is the daughter of third JoJo series protagonist Jotaro Kujo. Her beliefs are the same as those of her father. She is an unscrupulous girl who was arrested in a traffic accident and sentenced to 15 years in prison. She later learns that her imprisonment was actually a setup planned by the evil Father Enrico Pucci. She uses the ‘Stone Free’ Stand ability.

See More Jolyne Cujoh Goods on Buyee

Jotaro Kujo

Jolyne Cujoh’s father and the protagonist of the third part of the JoJo series, Jotaro Kujo is set as a kind hearted yet rough student, whose maternal grandfather is Joseph Joestar. He traveled to Egypt and defeated Dio Brando with his companions to save his mother’s life. He posses the Stand ‘Star Platinum’.

See More Jotaro Kujo Goods on Buyee

Ermes Costello

After a tragedy in her early life, Ermes Costello, a prison buddy of Jolyne Cujoh, learned that her mortal enemy was also in jail, and deliberately committed a crime in order to go to jail and track them down for revenge. She possesses the Stand called ‘Kiss’

See More Ermes Costello Goods on Buyee

Weather Report

Originally named Wes, he later took the name of his stand, also called Weather Report. This male prisoner who has lost his memory is taciturn, calm and composed. His true identity is Domenico Pucci, the long-lost twin brother of Enrico Pucci. At the time of his birth, another woman whose baby died in the same hospital stole him and separated him from his original family, renaming him Wes Bluemarine. At the age of 16, he met and dated Perla Pucci, but neither knew that they were blood relatives.

See More Weather Report Goods on Buyee

Narciso Anasui


A mysterious male prisoner staying in the room with Emporio and Weather Report. He has an ability to restructure things with his Stand Diver Down, and falls in love with Jolyne. When he was in college, he went to prison for murdering his girlfriend, who was having an affair. Emporio said that if Weather Report is not there to suppress Narciso, no one knows what he will do.

See More Narciso Anasui Goods on Buyee

Enrico Pucci


The final villain of the Stone Ocean series. When he saw the tomb of his twin brother Domenico in his childhood, he wondered if God had chosen himself instead of his brother, and he began to think about the meaning of happiness, leading to his motivation to go to the seminary. He met DIO at the age of 15, and later became close friends with him and obtained a piece of his bones. He wants to realize the theory of DIO in order to make the world happy, but the notebook that records this theory was burned by Jotaro Kujo. As a result, Enrico framed Jolyne Cujoh and imprisoned her, in order to lure her father Jotaro to come forward.

See More Enrico Pucci Goods on Buyee

In addition to the eight published JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure series, new content is still being serialized! If you want to begin to step into the world of JoJo, we recommend that you read the manga after watching the new animation!

Strengthen the showdown. Each installment has a different protagonist, and their nickname is JoJo. Although the settings are foreign, the fifth protagonist has Japanese heritage. In this world, a large number of supernatural elements such as vampires, zombies and ancient monsters have also been added, combined with real-world characters and events, giving JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure a richer world.







Releases on Netflix in December 2021!



At an animation event in August 2021, it was officially announced that an anime adaptation of the sixth story arc of JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure, Stone Ocean, will be released on Netflix, giving the world the opportunity to experience its fascinating story! This new anime series is being produced by studio David Production, director Kenichi Suzuki, supervisor Toshiyuki Kato, writer Yasuko Kobayashi, and composer Yugo Kanno. It will also be broadcast on major TV channels in Japan starting in January 2022.







The Main Characters of Stone Ocean



Jolyne Cujoh







Jolyne Cujoh, the protagonist of Stone Ocean is also known as JoJo, and is the daughter of third JoJo series protagonist Jotaro Kujo. Her beliefs are the same as those of her father. She is an unscrupulous girl who was arrested in a traffic accident and sentenced to 15 years in prison. She later learns that her imprisonment was actually a setup planned by the evil Father Enrico Pucci. She uses the ‘Stone Free’ Stand ability.




See More Jolyne Cujoh Goods on Buyee








Jotaro Kujo







Jolyne Cujoh’s father and the protagonist of the third part of the JoJo series, Jotaro Kujo is set as a kind hearted yet rough student, whose maternal grandfather is Joseph Joestar. He traveled to Egypt and defeated Dio Brando with his companions to save his mother’s life. He posses the Stand ‘Star Platinum’.




See More Jotaro Kujo Goods on Buyee








Ermes Costello







After a tragedy in her early life, Ermes Costello, a prison buddy of Jolyne Cujoh, learned that her mortal enemy was also in jail, and deliberately committed a crime in order to go to jail and track them down for revenge. She possesses the Stand called ‘Kiss’




See More Ermes Costello Goods on Buyee








Weather Report







Originally named Wes, he later took the name of his stand, also called Weather Report. This male prisoner who has lost his memory is taciturn, calm and composed. His true identity is Domenico Pucci, the long-lost twin brother of Enrico Pucci. At the time of his birth, another woman whose baby died in the same hospital stole him and separated him from his original family, renaming him Wes Bluemarine. At the age of 16, he met and dated Perla Pucci, but neither knew that they were blood relatives.




See More Weather Report Goods on Buyee








Narciso Anasui







A mysterious male prisoner staying in the room with Emporio and Weather Report. He has an ability to restructure things with his Stand Diver Down, and falls in love with Jolyne. When he was in college, he went to prison for murdering his girlfriend, who was having an affair. Emporio said that if Weather Report is not there to suppress Narciso, no one knows what he will do.




See More Narciso Anasui Goods on Buyee








Enrico Pucci







The final villain of the Stone Ocean series. When he saw the tomb of his twin brother Domenico in his childhood, he wondered if God had chosen himself instead of his brother, and he began to think about the meaning of happiness, leading to his motivation to go to the seminary. He met DIO at the age of 15, and later became close friends with him and obtained a piece of his bones. He wants to realize the theory of DIO in order to make the world happy, but the notebook that records this theory was burned by Jotaro Kujo. As a result, Enrico framed Jolyne Cujoh and imprisoned her, in order to lure her father Jotaro to come forward.




See More Enrico Pucci Goods on Buyee








In addition to the eight published JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure series, new content is still being serialized! If you want to begin to step into the world of JoJo, we recommend that you read the manga after watching the new animation!

items.title: All About Gundam SEED’s Memorable World!
items.content_html:
Mobile Suit Gundam SEED is an especially popular subseries within the Japanese Gundam anime franchise. Recently, fresh news related to this classic series come out that really surprised fans – A new SEED theatrical episode is now in production! Originally, there had been several SEED compilation movies produced before, so it’s not entirely surprising, but this new work, Mobile Suit Gundam Seed Eclipse, is different, as it tells a new story in the timeline. As the SEED Destiny series ended in Japan in 2005, it is a happy surprise to see a sequel in 2021!

The Setting of Gundam SEED

Mobile Suit Gundam SEED, directed by Mitsuo Fukuda, covers the story of Kira Yamato, who was born in an era called the “Cosmic Era”. Humans in this world are divided into “Naturals”, born and raised naturally on earth, and “Coordinators”, who were born after genetic modification. In this era of constant conflicts between these two groups, many Coordinators have chosen to immigrate to outer space, and the Kira family is no exception, emigrating to the Orb Union’s space colony Heliopolis.

Because where Kira lives is a neutral country, he originally had no connection with any outside war. One day, Heliopolis was attacked by the ZAFT army. Kira gets involved in the conflict at this point in order to protect others from the ZAFT soldiers. it was then discovered that the soldier who had attacked him was a childhood friend who he had not seen for many years, Athrun Zala. Starting from this reunion, the story continues from their perspectives and looks closely at the various causal relationships brought about by the war.

The Mobile Suits of Gundam SEED’s World

ZGMF-X10A Freedom Gundam

One of the main Gundams of the SEED universe, piloted by Kira Yamato, the main protagonist of the original Mobile Suit Gundam SEED. It can get more power from its METEOR support unit.

See More Freedom Gundam Goods on Buyee

ZGMF-X09A Justice Gundam

A Gundam that was shipped at the same time as the Freedom Gundam. Lighter than the Freedom Gundam, the Justice Gundam more than makes up for it in terms of mobility and tactical opportunities

See More Justice Gundam Goods on Buyee

ZGMF-X13A Providence Gundam

The last Gundam introduced by ZAFT in the war, piloted by Rau Le Creuset. Uses the DRAGOON system, Under which 11 floating guns stored in the Providence Gundam’s large backpack can be wirelessly controlled and attack opponents from multiple angles and directions at the same time. Utilizing 43 beam guns, Providence Gundam can release destructive firepower for attacks on all side.

See More Providence Gundam Goods on Buyee

Aile Strike Gundam

Originally piloted by Kira Yamato, he later passes ownership of this Gundam to Mu La Flaga. Was destroyed by Providence Gundam during a later battle in the Gundam SEED series, although the Pilot Mu managed to survive.

See More Aile Strike Gundam Goods on Buyee

GAT-X303 Aegis Gundam

One of the five newest mobile weapons in the GAT-X series developed by the Earth Alliance and piloted by Athrun Zala. The name ‘Aegis’ is derived from the shield with the head of Medusa in ancient Greek mythology. This Gundam’s unique feature is its transformation function.

See More Aegis Gundam Goods on Buyee

GATX-103 Buster Gundam

Developed by the Earth Alliance and piloted mainly by ZAFT soldier Dearka Elsman. Like the GAT-X102 Duel Gundam, it has a body type based on the X100 series skeleton and is modeled as a heavy artillery Gundam with powerful firepower. The “Buster” in the name of the machine references its destructive power.

See More Buster Gundam Goods on Buyee

GAT-X102 Duel Gundam

This Gundam was given a low evaluation by the Earth Alliance because it was the first prototype of the G weapon and lacked any special performance capabilities. After ZAFT stole this mobile suit, they specially designed a set of ‘Assault Shroud’ armor just for it.

See More Duel Gundam Goods on Buyee

GAT-X252 Forbidden Gundam

This mobile suit’s equipment features a scythe and a flying machine on its back. The flying machine can twist the opponent’s lasers so that the Forbidden Gundam’s body is not damaged. The pilot is Shani Andras. Andoras. This mobile suit is based on the X-200 series skeleton used in the GAT-X207 Blitz Gundam.

See More Forbidden Gundam Goods on Buyee

GAT-X370 Raider Gundam

This mobile suit was developed by the Earth Alliance, and is piloted by Lieutenant Clotho Buer. The three second generations Gundams developed in this Gundam’s series use the GAT-X X300 series skeleton, special Trans Phase armor for more power and protection.

See More Raider Gundam Goods on Buyee

GAT-X131 Calamity Gundam

A Gundam developed by the Earth Alliance that was taken by the ZAFT Army. The pilot is Orga Sabnak, a member of the Biological CPU trio.

See More Calamity Gundam Goods on Buyee

Before the new movie is officially released, it might be a good choice to spend time catching yourself up on the world of Mobile Suit Gundam SEED! We are really looking forward to all the new upcoming information on what’s to come next with Mobile Suit Gundam Seed Eclipse!

items.title: Popular Anime Tokyo Revengers Story and Character Guide
items.content_html:
Tokyo Avengers is a suspense-filled manga series from writer and illustrator Ken Wakui. In this story, protagonist Takemichi Hanagaki sees the death of his ex-girlfriend Hinata Tachibana and her brother Naoto caused by the Tokyo Manji Gang, or ‘Toman’. Takemichi has an accident shortly afterwards, but later comes to, now finding that he has traveled through time and space back to the past to the year 2005, and once again met Naoto who was supposed to have died. After Takemichi told Naoto about the future and both sides shook hands, he went back to the modern day of 2017. This time, Naoto, who should have died, appears again in front of Takemichi, this time as a detective. This is due to how the different actions taken in the past after traveling through time and space have changed the futures of many people. But the changed future is not a good and perfect ending. In order to save his ex-girlfriend and friends, Takemichi decides to once again travel through time and space to change the future.

Why is Tokyo Revengers So Popular?

In addition to its story of an interesting protagonist out to save the future, Tokyo Revengers also offers a deep look into the Tokyo Manji Gang, which Takemichi joins. The story will take the protagonist Takemichi Hanagaki through many misadventures in the past and the future, including ‘The Battle of 8/3’, ‘Bloody Halloween’, and the ‘Kanto Incident’. Probably the most fascinating thing to fans of the series are the friendships between the mobsters, and the intense fighting scenes.

The Main Cast of Tokyo Revengers

Takemichi Hanagaki

The protagonist of this work, is 26 in the present time and 12 in the past timeline. In order to escape from slavery, he broke up with his girlfriend and ran away. In the present time, he worked as a clerk in a DVD rental shop in Japan. He learned about the death of his ex-girlfriend on the news. Later, he was pushed down the subway track and died, but when he woke up, he found himself traveling through time and space to the past.

Browse Takemichi Hanagaki Merch

Manjiro ‘Mikey’ Sano

Commonly known as Mikey. One of the founders and current leader of Doman. He has a very high fighting talent, and is known as “Invincible Mikey”. Together with his elder brother Shinichiro and half-sister Emma, ​​he was taken care of by his grandfather and taught fighting skills when he was young. He worships his older brother, who was a bad boy as well. In order to get justice for a friend, the Tokyo Manji Gang was organized to defeat the Black Dragons

Browse Manjiro Sano Merch

Keisuke Baji


The captain of the Tokyo Manji Gang’s First Division, who is also Manjiro’s childhood playmate and one of the founders of Doman. When he was in middle school, he went to a store with his friend Kazutora Hanemiya to steal a CB250T locomotive in order to give it to Mikey. Later, because of Chifuyu’s protection, he did not enter a juvenile home. When he was supposed to move on to secondary school, he instead had to repeat it for one year.

Browse Keisuke Baji Merch

Ken Ryuguji (Draken)

Commonly known as ‘Draken’. One of the founders of Toman, a tall, loyal and upright person. He became friends with Mikey at a young age, and often assisted him. When he was a child, he was abandoned by his mother in the Shibuya Custom Shop. He was taken care of by the ladies in the shop, and considers it to be like his home. He likes Manjiro’s younger sister Emma, ​​but usually pretends not to care.

Browse Draken Merch

Chifuyu Matsuno

Deputy Captain of the First Division of the “Tokyo Swastika Society”. He has an arrogant personality. During his time in middle school, he grew to hate those who mistreat people below them. Since then, he has become a devoted member of the Tokyo Manji Gang, and an advisor to Takemichi.

Browse Chifuyu Matsuno Merch

Kazutora Hanemiya

One of the founders of the Toman, his troubles with the Black Dragons were the reason why his friends set up the Tokyo Manji Gang in order to fight them. He went with Keisuke Baji to steal a CB250T for Mikey, and was admitted to a juvenile home for two years because he was found to have killed Shinichiro, the bike’s owner. Unable to accept the reality of what happened, he persuaded himself to treat Mikey as an enemy, and confronted Toman with other mobsters.

Browse Kazutora Hanemiya Merch

This series takes you through a lot of travels through time and space and parallel timelines, and and is an enjoyable watch with equally interested friends. The manga comics are still being published, in addition to an anime series, live action movies and stage plays! If you are interested, go check out Tokyo Avengers for yourself!

items.title: Exploring The History of the Macross Series
items.content_html:
The first series in the highly popular Japanese anime franchise Macross was broadcast in Japan in 1982, and since then about 14 different Macross series have been released. Each individual series is very long, and it would be quite a task to cover all of them. So today, we have decided to present 7 select series in the series to recommend to you. It’s never too late if you want to catch up on the most important series! Now, come read the summaries below and choose the Macross series you want to watch next!

Macross Story Overview

The first key event of the Macross saga is around 500,000 years ago, with the prosperity and demise of the “Protoculture”. Other important points include humanity’s first contact with the Vajra alien creatures, when civilization first learned of the space folding navigation method, and when this method was further developed to support the war against aliens. With technology brought by aliens, the first Valkyrie variable fighters were also developed. These various technologies have played a large role in later events in the series, such as the First Space War, the Galactic Age of Navigation and the Battle of Ballota.

A long period of war between humans and aliens is covered in the Macross series. During the war, there are singers and bands whose singing voices have the power to encourage their friends or influence aliens. Each new series in the franchise is based on the perspective of the singers/bands of each era, showing their experiences and points of view during the war.

The First Choice for New Fans! 7 Recommended Macross Series

Super Dimension Fortress Macross

The first Macross anime series, running for a total of 36 episodes. Broadcast from the beginning of 1982, it was the first Japanese animation that successfully combined such disparate elements as idol singers, love, transforming robots and others. At that time, it set off a wave of enthusiasm and rose rapidly in popularity.

Super Dimension Fortress Macross tells the story of a huge meteorite that fell on South Ataria Island in the Pacific Ocean. After further investigation, the meteorite turned out to be a giant space warship with technology that surpassed that of human beings on Earth. After Earthlings learned that there were other highly intelligent creatures out in space, they integrated the human governments of all the world’s existing countries, and at the same time rebuilt this alien spacecraft, code-named ASS-1, renaming it the SDF-1 Macross. On the day of an event being held to celebrate the completion of the Macross’ reconstruction, the crew suddenly lost control of the ship.

Browse Super Dimension Fortress Macross Merch

Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: Lovers Again

Also known as Macross II, this is a story that continues from where the first anime series left off. The story takes place 80 years after the previous work (that is, in the year 2092) in what is now called the “Parallel World” timeline, separate from the main series timeline. In addition to the three essential elements of Macross, which are ‘songs, love triangles, and Valkyries’, Macross II’s other story elements are quite different from the last entry. Some major ones include the fact that the protagonist is not a pilot, and that the alien enemy also uses songs as a weapon. Other points such as the new Marduk alien race and the concept of the ace pilot this time instead being a beautiful girl give Macross a whole new refreshing look.

Browse Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: Lovers Again Merch

Macross Plus

This OVA continuation of the official Macross series timeline from the first anime is divided into four episodes. In 1995, a movie version of the four episodes edited together was released. Thirty years after the story of the first Macross, the United Army has developed new variable fighter jets in alien colonies. Macross Plus has three protagonists – Isamu, Guld, and Myung, who grew up together before moving on towards their different dreams. After the three grew up, they unexpectedly returned to their hometown at the same time. This reunion revived old feuds from long ago, and Isamu and Guld’s rivalry even causes issues with the military’s Project Super Nova that they are a part of.

Browse Macross Plus Merch

Macross 7

The Macross series’ famous fictional band ‘Fire Bomber’ takes the stage with this installment. The musician Basara Nekki tries to touch the Prododeviln alien enemy and others with his singing. This series has the musicians as its protagonists this time, witnessing what happened after the humans and the Zentradi made peace after the First Space War in Macross.

Browse Macross 7 Merch

Macross Zero

A OVA anime prequel story to the original Macross anime series, that covers the U.N. Wars, and the battles between humans to compete for alien technology. Taking place in an alternate version of the world in 2008 AD, around the time of its real world release, in which the Soviet Union did not disintegrate in the 1990s, there are many scenes of modern weapons appearing throughout the runtime. Macross Zero consists of five episodes, which were released from 2002 to 2004.

Browse Macross Zero Merch

Macross Frontier

The third anime series in the franchise is also the 25th anniversary commemorative work of the Macross series, running for a total of 25 episodes. It is the debut of the two singer characters Sheryl Nome and Ranka Lee. The story describes the story of these two singers and the flight candidate Alto Saotome. At the same time, it is also a story about the possibility of peace with aliens and the different thoughts of the humans and alien characters.

Browse Macross Frontier Merch

Macross Delta

The fourth anime series of the Macross franchise, the story of Macross Delta focuses on the Walküre singing idol team. Centered on the border of the Milky Way, there is a mysterious disease called ‘Var Syndrome’ that can cause infected people to go berserk. In order to combat this syndrome, Walküre and the Delta Flight Valkyrie squad team up in joint operations. Freyja Wion, one of the main protagonists, is a girl from the opposing Windermere Kingdom who soon joins Walküre to fight with its other members.

Browse Macross Delta Merch

The works of the Macross series are suitable for audiences of any age. Although each series has the main three story elements of songs, love triangles and Valkyries, they all also feature their own qualities! If you are interested, please choose your favorite series and check it out!

Broadcast from the beginning of 1982, it was the first Japanese animation that successfully combined such disparate elements as idol singers, love, transforming robots and others. At that time, it set off a wave of enthusiasm and rose rapidly in popularity.



Super Dimension Fortress Macross tells the story of a huge meteorite that fell on South Ataria Island in the Pacific Ocean. After further investigation, the meteorite turned out to be a giant space warship with technology that surpassed that of human beings on Earth. After Earthlings learned that there were other highly intelligent creatures out in space, they integrated the human governments of all the world’s existing countries, and at the same time rebuilt this alien spacecraft, code-named ASS-1, renaming it the SDF-1 Macross. On the day of an event being held to celebrate the completion of the Macross’ reconstruction, the crew suddenly lost control of the ship.




Browse Super Dimension Fortress Macross Merch








Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: Lovers Again







Also known as Macross II, this is a story that continues from where the first anime series left off. The story takes place 80 years after the previous work (that is, in the year 2092) in what is now called the “Parallel World” timeline, separate from the main series timeline. In addition to the three essential elements of Macross, which are ‘songs, love triangles, and Valkyries’, Macross II’s other story elements are quite different from the last entry. Some major ones include the fact that the protagonist is not a pilot, and that the alien enemy also uses songs as a weapon. Other points such as the new Marduk alien race and the concept of the ace pilot this time instead being a beautiful girl give Macross a whole new refreshing look.




Browse Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II: Lovers Again Merch








Macross Plus







This OVA continuation of the official Macross series timeline from the first anime is divided into four episodes. In 1995, a movie version of the four episodes edited together was released. Thirty years after the story of the first Macross, the United Army has developed new variable fighter jets in alien colonies. Macross Plus has three protagonists – Isamu, Guld, and Myung, who grew up together before moving on towards their different dreams. After the three grew up, they unexpectedly returned to their hometown at the same time. This reunion revived old feuds from long ago, and Isamu and Guld’s rivalry even causes issues with the military’s Project Super Nova that they are a part of.




Browse Macross Plus Merch








Macross 7







The Macross series’ famous fictional band ‘Fire Bomber’ takes the stage with this installment. The musician Basara Nekki tries to touch the Prododeviln alien enemy and others with his singing. This series has the musicians as its protagonists this time, witnessing what happened after the humans and the Zentradi made peace after the First Space War in Macross.




Browse Macross 7 Merch








Macross Zero







A OVA anime prequel story to the original Macross anime series, that covers the U.N. Wars, and the battles between humans to compete for alien technology. Taking place in an alternate version of the world in 2008 AD, around the time of its real world release, in which the Soviet Union did not disintegrate in the 1990s, there are many scenes of modern weapons appearing throughout the runtime. Macross Zero consists of five episodes, which were released from 2002 to 2004.




Browse Macross Zero Merch








Macross Frontier







The third anime series in the franchise is also the 25th anniversary commemorative work of the Macross series, running for a total of 25 episodes. It is the debut of the two singer characters Sheryl Nome and Ranka Lee. The story describes the story of these two singers and the flight candidate Alto Saotome. At the same time, it is also a story about the possibility of peace with aliens and the different thoughts of the humans and alien characters.




Browse Macross Frontier Merch








Macross Delta







The fourth anime series of the Macross franchise, the story of Macross Delta focuses on the Walküre singing idol team. Centered on the border of the Milky Way, there is a mysterious disease called ‘Var Syndrome’ that can cause infected people to go berserk. In order to combat this syndrome, Walküre and the Delta Flight Valkyrie squad team up in joint operations. Freyja Wion, one of the main protagonists, is a girl from the opposing Windermere Kingdom who soon joins Walküre to fight with its other members.




Browse Macross Delta Merch








The works of the Macross series are suitable for audiences of any age. Although each series has the main three story elements of songs, love triangles and Valkyries, they all also feature their own qualities! If you are interested, please choose your favorite series and check it out!

items.title: Board Gamer
items.content_html:
Here is an introduction to the latest popular Japanese stores. Learn about a wide range of products, including rare goods and great deals that can only be obtained from these Japanese stores.

Products

Astromino -To Pick Up The Stars-

A story of a world full of manna, the source of magic, which is a little different from here. In this game, the player becomes a sister of the church who believes in the elements, prays to the stars, and aims to expand the church facilities. The main game system requires resources to build church facilities with dice and worker placements, but to get the resources you have to predict where the stars will swing that night.

Product Page

Black Company Jack

Overview You who became the president of a black company. The only way to survive in this tough industry is to have employees work overtime. However, if you work overtime too much, you will end up with a black company and it will hinder your management. This is a blackjack card game where you can compete for how much overtime you can aim for!

Product Page

Swordsman Shogun Yoshiteru Ashikaga

This game is based on the theme of Yoshiteru Ashikaga, the 13th shogun of the Muromachi Shogunate, who was also famous as a master of swords. Become the Ashigaru head of the Miyoshi army who came to defeat Yoshiteru, and send out his subordinates to collect his swords. It is a card batting of cooperation and betrayal whose victory conditions change depending on the progress of the game. Number of players: 3-5 people Playing time: 20 minutes

Product Page

Life Carp

You who made a ridiculous blunder. Let’s “begging for a life that touches your heart” to get the forgiveness of the boss. Lastly, the person who played “the most reputable begging for life”, which received the most votes, won the championship. -Game features “Life Koi” is a board game that acts as a “life begging”. Players can sometimes choose different positions, such as being a hitman, being a doctor, or being a boss’s lover.

Product Page

World Travel Detective Series Tokyo Edition -Erica’s Letter and Mysterious Code-

Hello Tokyo, a world detective on the desk A video of a tourist attraction in Tokyo is a clue to solve the mystery! It is a mystery solving game that you can play while enjoying the experience of sightseeing at home. Upon receiving a mysterious request from a girl, she explores tourist attractions in Tokyo to solve the mystery. Let’s solve the mystery by using the cards and memos in the letter and the exploration video of Tokyo as clues. I would like people who have lost the opportunity to go sightseeing or travel abroad to enjoy this product due to the continued refraining from going out due to the coronavirus.

Product Page

Is your order a board game?

The world of the TV anime “Is the Order a Rabbit ??” has become a cute and annoying batting game. The flavor of the game is latte art, and there are also elements that fans can enjoy, such as using the latte art that appears in the game as a card in the hand. Of course, even if you don’t know the work, the cuteness of the appearance of latte art layering (completed) on the cup is exciting!

Product Page

SushiZume

If you eat rust, it will end immediately! A quasi-abstract that fights with sushi that you hold? !! Hold the sushi and start the game! If you clog your opponent’s ball, you win! -The abstract-style strategy game has a bluff element of adding rust! It is spectacular to see the sushi on the board getting packed! ‘SushiZume’ is a game played by two people.

Product Page

If you’re done with “I’m sorry”, you don’t need Keisatsu!

Ah, I did it. I have to bring some sweets and go to apologize. But who is the other person? Who should I apologize for? Ask everyone questions and find the victim! Go through the liar “Tehe ♡” card and her trap of his air player “Yamada-kun” and get points if you apologize to the victim well. The victim said, “I’m sorry, I’m sorry …” and relieved the stress!

Product Page

Store Introduction

Board Gamer

A board game specialty store created to let many people know the fun and charm of board games.

Product List

items.title: 7 Most Expensive and Rare Pokemon Cards Sold at Japanese Auction With Buyee
items.content_html:
The first series of the Pokemon TCG (Trading Card Game) franchise was released in Japan in October 1996.
Pokemon TCG cards are popular in the world of competitive card games, with many promotional events and tournaments held, and as a collectible fad, with many fans trying to “collect ’em all”. In recent years, there has been a trend of people starting to invest in Pokemon cards for their rising resale value.

Interested in what this world is like? Take a look below to see the 7 rarest and most expensive cards that have been sold at Japanese auctions with the proxy shopping service Buyee:

#7. Victory Orb (Battle Road 2005~2006 Print) – $5,707


Sold at 602,000 Yen (approx. $5,707) on January 26, 2020

Victory Orb cards were awarded to the top 3 winners from each age division in regional Japanese Battle Road Summer competitions from 2003 to 2006. This version featuring Mew was exclusively printed for the 2005 and 2006 tournaments.

It is estimated that 162 prints of this 2005-2006 Mew version exist.

#6. 2000 Pokemon Japanese Tropical Mega Battle Promo Lucky Stadium – $5,718


Sold at 600,000 Yen (approx. $5,718) on March 10, 2021

The Tropical Mega Battle cards were given to participants of the Japanese World Challenge Summer tournaments held from July to August 2000. Eight variations of this stadium themed card exist, each representing a region of Japan.
This version featuring Diglett is the Lucky Stadium card for the Tōhoku region, and was distributed at Sendai Wasse, Sendai on August 6, 2000.

It is extremely rare, with less than 50 prints existing.

#5. No.2 Trainer Neo Spring Road Print – $6,894


Sold at 750,000 Yen (approx. $6,894) on February 5, 2018

This No.2 TRAINER card was awarded to the runners-up of each regional Neo Spring Road tournament held between February and March 2001. It includes the name and regional conference of the tournament, and has male and female variants.

The illustration on this print was made by Ken Sugimori, illustrator of the original artwork for Pokemon games.

#4. Gyarados CoroCoro Pokemon Snap Best Photo Contest – $7,353


Sold at 784,000 Yen (approx. $7,353) on August 17, 2017

Japanese manga magazine CoroCoro Comic held the Best Photo Contest contest in May 1999, inviting readers to take pictures of Pokemon from the recently released Pokemon Snap on the Nintendo 64 and submit them for the contest. 5 winners had their photo taken from Pokemon Snap featured on reprints from Expansion Pack.

Each winner had 20 copies of their card made, meaning that only 20 copies of each version of this Gyarados card exist.

#3. 1998 Japanese Parent and Child Mega Battle Event Trophy Kangaskhan – $8,532


Sold at 900,000 Yen (approx. $8.532) on May 26, 2019

This Kangaskhan card was awarded at the Parent and Child Mega Battle Tournament held in May 1998, to parent and children teams who managed to win a certain number of matches.

This card is considered to be one of the best early promo Pokemon cards, having the original Pocket Monsters Trading Card Game logo as a set symbol.

#2. Pokemon Snap Best Photo Contest Winning Squirtle Card – $9,580


Sold at 1,000,000 Yen (approx. $9,580) on July 24, 2019

Similar to the CoroCoro Comic contest, the TV Tokyo variety show 64 Mario Stadium also held a Best Photo Contest in May 1999. 5 winners had their Pokemon Snap photographs featured on reprints from Expansion Pack.

Only 15 prints of each of these cards were given to the winners, which make this Squirtle card much rarer than CoroCoro Comic’s Gyarados card.

#1. Tamamushi University Magikarp – $9,890


Sold at 1,000,000 Yen (approx. $9,890) on February 13, 2021

The Tamamushi University Magikarp card was awarded as part of the Tamamushi University Hyper Test promotion held in June 1998 by Shogakukan Magazine. Students from Japanese primary schools were eligible to complete a series of tests and submit their answers to the magazine. Those who passed the test were invited to a tournament, where they could win one of these promotional Magikarp cards.

Why You Should Consider Buying Japanese Pokemon Cards From Japan

While Japanese Pokemon cards don’t offer any material value when using them to play in TCG card battles or compete in tournaments, they can be very valuable as collectibles.

Some reasons to buy Japanese cards are as follows:

  • To buy the newest deck sets/booster packs not available outside of Japan yet.
  • To get rare Japan exclusive cards such as limited print promotional, event, and trophy cards.
  • It’s usually cheaper to buy Japanese Pokemon cards from Japan than from your local retailers.
  • Some listings of individual cards on Japanese auctions (Yahoo! JAPAN Auction) and online flea market services have considerable resale values.

For example, here’s a price comparison of the Kangaskhan 1998 Japanese Parent and Child Mega Battle Event Trophy card between listings on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction and eBay.

On Yahoo Auction: The Kangaskhan card was won at 900,000 yen (approx. $8.532) with a buyout price of 1.25M yen.
This card was described as being in mint condition. Since most Japanese sellers are not familiar with the PSA card grading system, they usually describe their card as mint, near mint, good condition, bad condition, etc.

On eBay: There are listings from 5,493,297 yen (approx. 50,000 USD) for a PSA 3 Very Good graded card to 54,383,652 yen (approx. 500,000 USD) for a PSA 10 Gem Mint graded card, with an market average of 28,586,407 yen.

The non-graded mint Kangaskhan 1998 Japanese Parent and Child Mega Battle Event Trophy card listed on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction was 6 times cheaper than the PSA 3 graded card and 60 times cheaper than the PSA 10 gem mint card on eBay.

Buy Japanese Pokemon cards on Buyee!

Buyee is a Japanese proxy service. It allows people living outside of Japan to purchase goods and merchandise from Japanese online stores and auctions, including Yahoo! JAPAN Auction. It’s a great way to get products exclusive to Japan for a more affordable price that what you would find locally.

Use Buyee to purchase rare Japanese Pokemon cards and TGC decks exclusive to Japan or released earlier than in the U.S. directly from Japan!

BUY POKEMON CARDS ON BUYEE

Recommended Stores

Here below are some recommended stores for Pokemon cards available on Buyee:

  • Individual Rare Japanese Cards: Yahoo! JAPAN Auction (Japan’s largest auction site ), Mercari Japan (Japan’s largest flea market service)
  • Decks: Amazon Japan, Rakuten, Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping, Pokemon Center Japan

Check out our partnered Youtubers’ content on Japanese Pokemon trading cards!

BUY POKEMON CARDS ON BUYEE

items.title: Get Exercising with Nintendo Switch! 5 Trending Japanese Indoor Exercise Games
items.content_html:
When doing exercises to achieve long-term weight loss, in addition to the time required to see any benefits, a certain degree of endurance is also required. This endurance requires strong motivation, and video games on systems such as the Nintendo Switch have been shown to provide the best kind of motivation for anyone who wants to achieve weight loss, which is to play while exercising!

The 5 games we will present in this article are all ones that have been recognized by the gaming public as providing great slimming benefits after regular use. They can cause you to happily tackle the game’s challenges while unknowingly breaking a heavy sweat, helping you to acquire the benefits of aerobic exercise and weight loss. If you are interested, we hope you will take a look!

Ring Fit Adventure

Ring Fit Adventure is a fitness game developed by Nintendo for the Nintendo Switch. The Ring-Con accessory introduced with the game is made of polyester fiber and nylon and has great elastic strength. There are sensors in the ring that can sense the player’s movements. The player needs to detach the Switch’s Joy-Con controllers and insert them into the Ring-Con and the Leg Strap, respectively. The game is turn-based according to different movements that the player must perform. It has an RPG adventure game where you only need to use Ring-Con and Leg Strap to match the actions in the game in order to defeat monsters and beat levels. The game also includes fitness-specific mini-games and fitness exercises and other modes for players to choose.

Find Ring Fit Adventure on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Fit Boxing 2: Rhythm & Exercise

In this game, the player holds the Joy-Con controllers and follows the in-game instructions to simulate boxing in accordance with the rhythm, while at the same time enduring fun physical training. If you play this boxing game often, maybe you too could become a boxing pro!

Find Fit Boxing 2 on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Zumba Burn it Up!

Zumba is an international lifestyle program that mixes fitness, entertainment, culture and various other elements. This series of games can be your perfect introduction to Zumba! Rhythms from all over the world are added to the game. Players can simply go along with the rhythm to exercise, making you feel like you are truly having a party.

Find Zumba Burn it Up! on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

FiNC HOME FiT

Based on martial arts such as boxing, karate, Muay Thai, and Kung Fu, FiNC HOME FiT has developed aerobic exercises that burn fat efficiently and exercise the muscle groups of the entire body. Includes fitness games where you build up your strength simply by matching your movements to the rhythm.

Find FiNC HOME FiT on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Just Dance 2021

Just Dance 2021 is the ultimate dance game, featuring 40 new top singles on the charts. You can start a rocking party with your family and friends and dance the day away!

Find Just Dance 2021 on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

These games are the perfect fit for those who like to exercise indoors, or who want to lose weight while saving time! Remember everyone – if you are looking for convenient exercise in busy situations, the Nintendo Switch may your best place to play!
