items.title: The Best and Weirdest Video Games in Japan – 2020 Edition!
items.content_html:
As the holiday season begins and people begin to consider what the best gift would be to get for friends and family, video games are always a popular choice! If you are leaning toward getting a fun piece of software for someone you know, why not give this article a look? We have included a list of games that enjoyed great success with Japanese audiences this year! In addition, we have featured some of what we are calling the ‘weirdest games in Japan’, that capture the unique spirit that can make big cult classics out of so many of Japan’s games! Give that special someone a taste of games that have become ‘Big in Japan’!

The Top 5 Hit Japanese Games of 2020

Here is a list of the 5 games that we felt made the biggest impact in Japan during 2020. Although 2020 has been an unpredictable year thus far, the popularity of these games is strong enough to overcome this feeling, or even become popular due to how their playstyle matches the current environment!

Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo Switch)

Although the Animal Crossing series has been popular worldwide since it began nearly 20 years ago, this newest entry has reached an unprecedented level of success! It is said that its open, independent game design that has the player build a home and friendships in a virtual world has been especially popular with people wishing to escape the frustrations of the current year. Its online mode also provides a way to socialize with other fans regardless of the real world situation!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

This is a unique kind of exercise-role-playing game that uses its packed-in physical attachments (the Ring-Con and Leg Strap) to enable easy exercise at home while enjoying light story and action gameplay. Frequent lockdowns that caused many exercise facilities and gyms to close in 2020 have led to an incredible surge in demand for this game, making it one of the most popular games on the Switch.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Ring Fit Adventure (Nintendo Switch)

Fortnite (2017 – Various Platforms)

Fortnite has been released on many platforms, from handhelds to home consoles to mobile phones, since its successful launch in 2017. Its Battle Royale mode in particular has gained an enthusiastic worldwide fanbase, and Japan is no different! You can find many popular Japanese gaming personalities who dedicate much of their time to Fortnite matches!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Soccer is a very popular sport in Japan, and while this has led to multiple successful locally-made franchises such as the Inazuma Eleven games or Konami’s Pro Evolution Soccer series, FIFA still has many fans. The gameplay is easy to get into casually and hard to master, making it an addictively fun experience that boasts a huge worldwide fanbase, even during the uncertainty of 2020.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

FIFA 21 (2020 – Various Platforms)

Final Fantasy VII Remake (PS4)

A remake of the 1997 classic, this long-in-development PS4 exclusive managed to exceed expectations to build its own separate identity and become a hit in its own right! It has found many fans in Japan who still have fond memories of the original version.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

5 Weird Japanese Video Games!

For those who wish to find something a bit out of the ordinary for this holiday season, please give this next list a look! These ‘weird’ Japanese games are not all necessarily from this year, but their unique qualities have a life long beyond their time on store shelves! They would be perfect for that person in your life who wants to try a game that would give a very new kind of experience!

Sakuna: Of Rice and Ruin (2020 – Nintendo Switch, PS4, PC)

This recent Japanese release may have gained notice from its pleasing combination of farming-simulation and action game genres, but its intense focus on an extremely detailed depiction of rice cultivation, which took 5 years to develop, is what gives it that uniquely Japanese quality. The kind of game that will remain a topic of conversation for years to come!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

This experimental game for the original Playstation comes from creator Osamu Sato, who saw his games as a way of exhibiting art. LSD is based on a years-long dream diary of an employee at its developer, and its surreal design has become a topic of conversation in recent years among online Japanese game enthusiast communities.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

LSD: Dream Emulator (1998 – PS1)

Mister Mosquito (2001 – PS2)

Just from the Japanese cover which you can see to the left, you can tell that Mister Mosquito (Known as Ka in Japan, or just ‘Mosquito’) may be the perfect game for this list! In fact, Eidos Interactive, which published it outside of Japan, specifically stated that they were attracted to its ‘odd’ and ‘quirky’ qualities that are normally not available in games outside of Japan! Perhaps too strange for audiences outside of Japan, its 2004 sequel ended up only being released in Japan. However, dedicated fans held out hope that Sony would eventually localize it at the time.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

This Japanese video game is legendary for its uniqueness in design. Players raise a fish with a human face in one of the oddest experiences to ever be made for a major home console! It even makes use of the Dreamcast microphone attachment to achieve its strange goals, allowing you to have limited conversations with the creature as it grows to adulthood. Truly a game like none other!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

Seaman (2001 – Sega Dreamcast)

Kuma Uta (2003 – PS2)

When it comes to notable ‘cult’ Japanese games for the Playstation 2, Kuma Uta (Bear Song) is among the strangest! This game stars a polar bear who gets into enka, a traditional Japanese genre of singing. The bear will ask questions, and you answers will inform the custom lyrics of the songs that it sings in the game!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

items.title: The 10 Best Traditional and Modern Japanese Board Games to Try in 2020
items.content_html:
When you first think about Japanese games, the first thing that comes to mind may be Mario or Sonic, but Japan has enjoyed dozens of unique tabletop games since long before anyone ever picked up a game controller! Some of these board games date back centuries, but they are still enjoyed to this day due to their creativity and challenge. This article will cover 5 of these traditional games, along with 5 more modern ones that may feel more familiar to you!

5 Top Traditional Japanese Board Games

Shogi: Chess with a Japanese Spin

Similar to chess, this two-player board game involves strategy, patience and cunning. There are 20 pieces per side with different abilities and rules for each piece. Unlike chess, units can be promoted once they reach the back row of the board, giving them extra movement abilities. Shogi allows players to take captured enemy units as their own, which keeps the game dynamic until the last move. Though complex, beginners can also have fun, which is why it is the most popular board game in Japan!

See More on Rakuten

Go: The Ancient Asian Game of Strategy

Go is generally considered to be the world’s oldest board game. Players take turns placing black and white stones on the board’s intersecting gridlines with the goal of forming territories by surrounding and capturing their opponent’s pieces. The game rewards patience and balance over aggression and greed. Go’s simple rules can be learned quickly, but it takes a lifetime to master. The staggering number of possibilities in any given game has made it quite popular worldwide.

See More on Rakuten

Gomoku: Simple at First, But Built to Last!

Gomoku, or ‘five in a row’, is a very different type of game from Go, but is played with the same stones and board. Players alternate placing their pieces on the board, trying to create a line of five in a row. The challenge comes not only from blocking the other player, but also making sure you don’t exceed five stones per line. Unlike Go, the pieces can not move once they’re played. Think of it as the ultimate version of tic tac toe!

See More on Rakuten

Japanese Mahjong: New Twists on an Old Favorite

Mahjong is a traditional tile-based game where you play with three other players to try and form winning hands. In the West it is often compared to poker or rummy. Japanese Mahjong has it own unique and specific rules that make for a different experience! Worldwide, Mahjong’s popularity has only risen in recent years, and maybe with an easy-to-use portable set you could join the fad as well!

See More on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Sugoroku: Slap First and Win in This Classic Japanese Card Game!

When you talk about the classic board game sugoroku in Japanese, there is the ban-sugoroku (board sugoroku) variety and the e-sugoroku (picture sugoroku) variety, which have different playstyles. A game with centuries of history in Japan, where its use in gambling caused it to be banned multiple times, sugoroku has stayed popular as a game anyone can enjoy in many ways. For example, the left image shows a sugoroku set meant for young kids to learn about the locations of Japan as they play!

See More on Rakuten

5 Trending Modern Japanese Board Games

Donjara: An Easier Mahjong For Kids!

Donjara, also known as Ponjan, is a simplified version of Japanese Mahjong aimed at children. It can be played with 2 to 4 players, and produces tie-in sets with franchises enjoyed by younger audiences to maintain its popularity, such as Youkai Watch, Doraemon, or as the left image shows, the recent hit anime series Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba!

See More on Rakuten

The Jinsei Game: Playing Japan’s Game of Life

Initially released by Takara Tomy in 1967, the Jinsei Game is the Japanese version of The Game of Life, a board game which many Western audiences are familiar with. The rules of the Jinsei Game differ slightly from The Game of Life, having players first go through the initial life stages of childhood development. While some game details have changed over the years, its core rules still remain the same, continuing to entertain generations of Japanese families.

See More on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

The Hatteiu Game: A Recent Trending Hit Game!

The Hatteiu Game is a Japanese game that just began gaining popularity recently, with its first edition only having been released in 2018! As it is so recent, a standard translation of the title has not been set, but based on the rules, a name like ‘The Say Something Game’ would fit! You get a theme for each round that has a list of ways to say a single words. Players get a card telling them what style they play. By viewing each act and betting chips on what style it was, the players accumulate points for right answers and correct votes on their act! Japanese knowledge might be required, but you can watch the video below to see how a typical game goes!

See More on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Durian: Don’t Anger the Gorilla!

Durian is another recent Japanese game with a unique twist that can be both fun and funny. Players play as shop clerks ordering fruit from a gorilla. However, players are unable to see the full inventory list, so other players can use the small bell game piece to tell the gorilla if the other player is ordering too much. The winner is the player who manages to make the gorilla angry the least!

See More on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

Tokyo Highway: A Board Game with no Board!

Tokyo Highway is a board game where you build the set as you play! Work with other players to construct criss-crossing highways and columns from the set pieces. Each time your road crosses over or under another player’s road, you get to place one car on the highway. But beware – if you accidentally knock over someone else’s car or highway piece, you must give them an equivalent number of column pieces as a penalty! The first player to reach 10 cars on the road wins!

See More on Rakuten

Purchasing Japanese Board Games Online

If you are curious about giving some of these different styles of Japanese board games a try, proxy shipping services like Buyee are the simplest way to get Japan-only games from the seller to you! Whether traditional or modern, the two shops below are just some of the stores on Buyee that can service your gameplay needs!

items.title: Kamen Rider’s Secrets to Success!
items.content_html:
Kamen Rider is a Japanese tokusatsu superhero series that has enjoyed amazing popularity over the course of its more than 40 year run! It has seen this success spread to countries outside of Japan as well, so nowadays you will find fans worldwide who know a lot about the famous Kamen Rider series. But what are the reasons for this long success? Read on to learn more!

The Stories are Easy to Follow

The Kamen Rider series actually has a lot of complex stories, including elements that even adults can enjoy. However, the most important story element that every narrative is built around is that the Kamen Rider hero will transform and fight strange and powerful monsters. This clear, easy-to-understand part of the series is a big reason for its popularity.

New Series Techniques That Follow The Current Trends

As card battles became a big part of popular culture, the Kamen Rider series made sure to incorporate card battle elements into many of its series as well, such as Kamen Rider Ryuki, Sword, and Decade. When cellphone usage grew in Japan, Kamen Rider 555 introduced a hero who transformed using a cellphone. Kamen Riders that incorporate what is popular at that time in this sense allow the series to keep a strong relevance.

The meaning of the ‘Rider’ part of the name can change as well – while Kamen Rider is mainly considered to ride bikes, there have been vehicle types as various as the car of Kamen Rider Drive, the bike that connected to and controlled the DenLiner train in the Den-O series, and the rocket-like bike of the Fourze series.

The above examples show just some of the ways in which the changing themes of Kamen Rider in response to changes in the times keep it interesting and fun for new generations of fans worldwide!

Handsome Leading Men!

This next factor is also important but a little different! Usually while children are absorbed in watching Kamen Rider on TV, their mothers also get caught up in the action, but for another reason! That is due to the handsome actors that are chosen to play the heroes!

A Huge Amount of Collectible Merch

Toys and other collectible merch have been an important part of the Kamen Rider series since its inception. The more series goods you collect, the more you will grow attached to Kamen Rider, and then start to care more about how the next installments in the story. This great abundance of items has made children enthusiastic series fans for years.

Collectible items are developed in coordination with each new series, such as the Fullbottles from Kamen Rider Build, The Kamen Rider OOO medals that the hero uses to transform, and the powerful lockseeds from Kamen Rider Gaim. Recently, versions of Kamen Rider’s famous Henshin Belts have been released in adult sizes as well!

Kamen Rider Adult Henshin Belt

items.title: The Popular Collectible Bearbrick Toys
items.content_html:
What is Bearbrick?

Bearbrick is a brand of bear-shaped collectible figures made by the Japanese company MediCom Toy. Developed with the highly original concept of ‘making a teddy bear with a digital image’, the first Bearbrick was available in May of 2001, and it has since become a sought-after collectible line of merchandise for collectors. Its cute and cartoony bear design comes from MediCom Toy’s earlier Kubrick toy brand. Keep reading on for an overview of the sizes and designs available with Bearbrick, along with some select collaborative models that any fan would love to have!

A Variety of Different Sizes are Available!

One of the most notable features of the Bearbrick toy line is the number of different sizes and designs that they come in, which gives a great amount of choice to those who might want to go for a different kind of toy.

The Bearbrick sizes are referred to with a percentage, with which dedicated fans can easily figure out the corresponding size and value. A ‘100% Bearbrick’ (7 cm size) is considered to be the standard size. The figure sizes can be radically different, as seen in the picture to the left. Here is a quick guide to available sizes:

  • 50% Bearbrick: 3.5 cm size
  • 70% Bearbrick: 5 cm size
  • 100% Bearbrick: 7 cm size
  • 150% ‘Bearbrick Light’: 10.5 cm size recent model with key chain
  • 200% Superalloyed Bearbrick: 14.5 cm size, collaboration with famous Japanese brand of robot action figure toys
  • 400% Bearbrick: 28 cm size, usually sold standalone, not in box set
  • 1000% Bearbrick: 70 cm size, usually sold standalone, not in box set

The 400% Bearbrick and 1000% Bearbrick sizes are usually what the serious collectors go for, but there are Bearbrick models available for any need! For example, there is also a ‘BB Bearbrick’ model for kids that does not have detachable parts like other models would. Take a look and see which size works best for you!

Limited Edition and Collaborative Bearbrick Designs

When it comes to the world of Bearbrick collectors, what is especially popular are the collaborative models. These are Bearbricks with special designs produced together with anyone from fashion brands, visual artists or other famous designers. There are also exclusive models released in coordination in Japanese product launches that later become highly sought after, especially by fans outside of Japan. Some well-known names that have contributed their designs to Bearbricks include KAWS, FaZe Clan, Supreme and A Bathing Ape.

Popular Bearbrick Models

Here are just a few examples of some Bearbricks whose designs have become popular among fans:

Bearbrick x A Bathing Ape Model

A Bathing Ape, also referred to as Bape, is a Japanese fashion brand with loyal fans worldwide. You can feel the impact of their striking and modern designs, even in this small 7 cm Bearbrick 100% model.

Check Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping Store

Bearbrick x KAWS Model

This model, officially known as the ‘BE@RBRICK KAWS Companion a-nation 1000%’, came about from a collaborative effort between Bearbrick and KAWS. KAWS is a world-renowned street artist, and his signature design of having X’s for eyes on his art can be seen in this high quality Bearbrick model as well!

Check Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping Store

Bearbrick x Daft Punk Model

These 70 cm 1000% Bearbricks are the result of a collaboration between Bearbrick and the famous French electronic music act Daft Punk. Daft Punk collaborates with Bearbrick every year, but this 2012 model is especially popular and has become shockingly expensive.

Check Rakuten Store

Have you found a Bearbrick model that speaks to you yet? With dozens of amazing designs in a number of different sizes, there is definitely a Bearbrick out there that could become anything from your next pocket lucky charm to your next larger-sized decorative figure. Check out Buyee to see how you can buy the most exclusive models that normally never leave Japanese shopping sites, even from overseas!

Check on Buyee

items.title: 5 Select Rare Dragon Ball Figures
items.content_html:
While there has been a huge amount of Dragon Ball figures released from companies like Banpresto or Bandai in exclusive series such as rise-figure Standard and Evolve, we would like to cut though the fat this time to introduce you to some of the most sought-after figures that have been released over the years!

In recent years, the soaring prices of Dragon Ball series figures have been gaining attention in the competitive world of the Japanese action figure market. The figures being introduced here are all normally very difficult to obtain for ordinary fans.

Dragon Ball Selection Figures

Figures from this series were originally only sold for 7,000 yen per unit, but their average asking price has soared due to their growing popularity overseas. It is now quite difficult to gather all seven figures in this set and complete the collection. Many people seem to be aiming to collect them all because everything in this series is considered to be made with a high degree of quality, down to the design of the box.

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

Super Festival Great Ape Figure

A rare piece of merch that was sold at an exhibition and sales event called ‘Super Festival’. It is a figure that you hardly see for sale because it is rarely put on the market. Even on Buyee it has been hard for people to get their hands on one of these figures whenever they show up!

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

SMSP Vegeta Two Dimensions Prize Model

A wonderfully unique model that dares to feature a two-dimensional bold coloring style to emphasize Vegeta’s modeling and visual flair in the way that he would appear on the pages of the original manga.

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

Desktop REAL McCOY Dragon Ball Series

This well-known illustration is brought into the third dimension with this ‘desktop series figure’. Reproduces even the finest details of creator Akira Toriyama’s original artwork, making you feel as if it has simply leaped off the pages of the Shonen Jump manga magazine! If you are a Dragon Ball fan, this is a figure series that you will want at least one of to decorate your home!

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

‘Zoukei’ Tenkaichi Budokai Series Figure Series

A figure series that every Dragon Ball fan is itching to get their hands on! You can feel the creator of these figures’ love for Dragon Ball just from looking at them. For the ‘Zoukei Tenkaichi Budokai’ series, six motivated masters of figure-making are brought together to create their own Dragon Ball figures and compete for ranking. Featured in this image is a figure of young Son Goku from the Zoukei Tenkaichi Budokai 2 Series. His youthful energy that exudes cuteness and cool can be felt from this high-quality model!

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

The Figure Events Stop for No One!

Many figure-related events have unfortunately been cancelled in 2020. It has been hard thus far, but here’s a piece of good news! The Mega Hobby 2020 expo will be held online this year:

https://megahobbyexpo.jp/

It will be held for 3 days from October 30, 2020! Check it out! More information on the figures to be released at this event is posted here (Japanese Only):

https://www.megahobby.jp/event/specialweek/

items.title: How to Get Ichiban Kuji Lottery Prizes – From Japan and Overseas!
items.content_html:
Ichiban Kuji is Great for Game and Anime Merch Fans!

Do you know about the Japanese ‘Ichiban Kuji’ lottery contests? In Japan, you are able to enter this lottery by making purchases at a variety of convenience stores, bookstores and anime merchandise shops. Since a Pokemon Ichiban Kuji event was held in 2003 at participating 7-Eleven stores, this lottery has featured an ever-growing selection of franchises such as the Gundam or One Piece series. The limited availability period and exclusive, high quality goods offered in Ichiban Kuji lotteries are just some of the reasons for their enduring popularity. As an example, just last month there was a new Kimetsu no Yaiba: Demon Slayer Ichiban Kuji event. In the early morning hours of the day that this event started, there were long lines already waiting to make their lottery purchases, and the lottery was sold out by the end of that same day!

While there are a lot of anime and game series featured in Ichiban Kuji lotteries, it has branched out into other categories as well. These include Disney characters such as Mickey Mouse, popular franchises like Rilakkuma and Sumikko Gurashi, and idol merchandise from bands like AAA and JO1. The Ichiban Kuji lottery system also includes offshoots such as Ichiban Kuji Premium and Ichiban Kuji V.

How to Participate in an Ichiban Kuji Contest

Here is how you join an Ichiban Kuji lottery at participating Japanese convenience stores. When you first enter the store, you should see Ichiban Kuji vouchers displayed on the counter in front of the cash register along with other goods. Take this and go to the register. At the register, tell the staff the number of entries you would like, and then pay at the counter. The lottery tickets are inside a raffle box, so once you pay for your entries, insert your hand into the box and pull out as many tickets as you paid for. The convenience store staff can open the tickets you pulled for you. If any say that you have won a certain rank of prize, then you can trade these directly with the staff member for the corresponding prize!

The Recommended Way to Get Prizes from Overseas

Even if you do not live in Japan, don’t worry! If you can’t buy tickets directly at a convenience store in Japan, there are still ways to get your favorite prizes.

Purchase Merch Listed on Yahoo! Auction JAPAN and Mercari via Proxy Purchase Sites

With this method, you can be sure that you get what you want. The only issue is that prices can be high. Make sure that when you go to purchase rare items, you are carefully checking to see if they are really worth what the seller is asking for!

Buyee is our recommended proxy purchase site. This online service is an official partner of stores like Yahoo! Auction JAPAN and Mercari. There are many delivery methods and accepted payment types, and the fees are reasonable. You can visit it via the link below:

Visit Buyee

In the next section, we will feature Ichiban Kuji series prizes that you can purchase on Buyee!

Dragon Ball Series

Featuring the heroes, villains and monsters from across the storied history of the Dragon Ball franchise, you are sure to find great Ichiban Kuji prizes for your favorite character here!

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction
Browse on Mercari

One Piece Series

As the best-selling manga series in history, the One Piece series’ popularity has naturally led to a great variety of Ichiban Kuji lottery prizes, from figures and keychains to pens and plates! You can find all these and more via the store links below!

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction
Browse on Mercari

Animal Crossing Series

The Animal Crossing series revolves around relaxing and enjoying life while pursuing your interior design dreams, so it’s only natural that the prizes that you can find below follow that same trend! Everything from coffee mugs to cloths and even mini table furniture are available to help you bring a bit of Animal Crossing spirit into your life!

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction
Browse on Mercari

Purchasing at Ichiban Kuji ONLINE and Shipping via Transfer Services

Ichiban Kuji will also sometimes holds online sales. There is normally no previous notice, so it is recommended to always keep an eye on the site. Goods from the Ichiban Kuji cannot be shipped overseas, but you can purchase them by using methods such as overseas forwarding services.

一番くじONLINE https://www.banprestore.com/kuji/
Tenso https://www.tenso.com/

Build your collection with the store links below! Get Japan-exclusive Ichiban Kuji lottery prizes and become the envy of your friends!

Yahoo! JAPAN Auction
Browse on Mercari

items.title: The Top 5 Shockingly Expensive TCG Cards!
items.content_html:
Have you ever played any trading card game series, such as Yu-Gi-Oh! or the always popular Pokemon trading card game?

As fans of these trading card game series will know, over the years some cards have become very rare and hard to obtain. The most serious collectors of trading cards will want to buy these cards no matter how much they cost. Some people may be thinking that a single card couldn’t possibly fetch such a high fee. Those who think so are sorely mistaken – the prices are far beyond anything you could imagine! Listed below are the TOP 5 most expensive single cards extracted from Yahoo Auction products via Buyee over the past year. Let’s take a look and be amazed together!

#5: Son Goku and Gohan 3000 Copy Limited Foil Card (Approx. $2,900)

This exclusive card comes from Dragon Ball Carddass, which is a Dragon Ball Z themed trading card series out of many released by Bandai which are made to interact with their ‘Data Cardass’ line of arcade machines. This card was a lottery gift sent out to commemorate the release of the second series, and was limited to just 3000 copies!

#4: Mox Ruby β Beta (Approx. $4,818)

Magic the Gathering, or ‘MTG’, is said to be one of the most complex games in existence. Due to the rich history of its world, its deep strategy, and interesting and mysterious magical creatures, MTG has become very popular all over the world. This card Mox Ruby β Beta, goes for an incredible price. However, in the MTG, this is only considered to be the 8th most expensive card! Black Lotus, the legendary and most expensive MTG card, costs over five times as much as this card!

Browse Here

#3: Tropical Wind Promo Card (Approx. $6,550)

This Pokemon trading card game card was issued in 1999 as a prize for participants in the Tropical Mega Battle Tournament. Since this is a genuine first edition card from 1999, the price is especially high!

Browse Here

#2: Blue-Eyes White Dragon V Jump Festa ’99 1000 Copy Limited (Approx. $6,663)

This extremely limited card was only given out to 1000 visitors at the V Jump Festa 1999. However, even this amount is not so high compared to other cards. The Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon card from the same series is said to be the most expensive in the world, and costs about $421,000!

Browse Here

#1: Pokemon Snap Best Photo Contest Winning Squirtle Card (Approx. $9,357)

A special card created as part of a campaign commemorating the release of Pokemon Snap for the Nintendo 64, a game which has you become a photographer and take pictures of Pokemon (And has an upcoming sequel that was announced recently!). This card that won a contest in which fan-created photos were carefully judged and the top photos were made into a real Pokemon card for the prize winners. This card’s price may shock you, but the all-time most expensive Pokemon card sold for about $60,833!

Find The Rare Card of Your Dreams!

Shocking, isn’t it! There are many rare cards available on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction, so finding ones this expensive is not uncommon. These include Animal Crossing Amiibo cards, which has been selling out recently due to their usefulness for getting villagers in the hit game Animal Crossing New Horizons! On some websites you have to wait more than 3 months even if you make a reservation to purchase them, but you can find them here! Due to Yahoo! JAPAN Auction’s bidding system, there is a good chance that you can snap up the item you want at a much cheaper price! Browse current trading card auctions via the link below!

Browse Here
